result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason G Jolin

records.addlTxt: Jury trial on December 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jason G Jolin appeared by video.  Attorney Michael C Turner appeared by video for Jason G Jolin.  Attorney Jordan W. Feest appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is rejecting the State's offer (the offer was $100.00 fine plus costs).  Defendant wishes to proceed to trial.  
State revokes its offer.
Pretrial conference set for 11-29-2022 at 10:30am
Jury Trial set for 12-14-2022 (2 days).  
Parties to file any motions in limine, jury instructions, etc. at least 10 days prior to trial.
Pre-trial conference on November 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on August 5, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Status conference on July 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Michael Turner is appointed as counsel of record.  Defendant is to reimburse the county at a rate of $250.00 per month commencing 06-01-22.
Mailed to defendant on 4-26-22.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Scheduling conference on May 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Received a call from defendant stating that "I'm going to see my child for the first time in 20 years in Michigan and if anybody has a problem with this they are going to have to kill me to stop me from seeing my child".
Defendant then gave me his address, phone and DOB and said he will be in our office within 45 minutes to sign his recognizance bond.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

Court enters not guilty plea.   Jury Calendar.   Offer deadline with DA is set for 04-08-22 at 8:30 a.m.   Scheduling conference is set for 05-04-22 at 10:00 a.m.    Bail is set at $150.00 recognizance bond.   Defendant refuses to sign bond.   
Minutes.
Initial appearance on February 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Initial appearance on February 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Re:  Disorderly conduct, on 11-23-21.   
Initial appearance is set for 02-17-22 at 10:30 a.m.
